item.title: Where IS the pubic toilet and the paddling pool???, 16th August
item.description:
Is this a Grade 2 sign? If so fine. If not where is the paddle pool?? Where are the PUBLIC toilets? Many residents (and park workers) will statistically have urology issues? Or mums-to-be, kids , or others recovering from operations and needing time in the green environment will also have frequent reason to use a toilet. If the closest is in The Glades. Then signpost this! The neglect of this sign is another indicator of the neglect of these gardens.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tetty Way, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area around drain cover sinking., 16th August
item.description:
There is a drain cover located on the A223 Bourne Road Bexley ( What 3 words -- best.front.lofts) this road suffers from HGV and LGV vehicle travelling at excessive speed, they hitting this area and causing it to sink further it also causes a loud bang each time and send heavy vibrations which can be felt at local houses. this is getting progressively worse and needs to be investigated and repaired, this road is heavily used by Heavy vehicles 24 hrs a day so the issue of them speeding needs to be addressed also.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree looks to be a potential hazard, 16th August
item.description:
In Church House Gardens the trees are generally not being look after. Beautiful acer tree are being swamped by samplings, ivy, and brambles. There is thisone tree that looks to be very distressed. Possibly case of developed Ash-Die-Back. There is the potential to collapse onto the recently sold Churchill Theatre (now owne by Galliard proterties) with potential insurance claim. Please could this investigated by the Bromley TREE team (and any required action taken) along with ALL the tree within the park. A report made available so that a managment stratagey can be developed along with the Friends group to bring these gardens back from the brink.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tetty Way, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
